arm_group.description: TKR surgery under ultrasound guided sciatic nerve block plus femoral nerve block plus obturator nerve block

arm_group.arm_group_label: TKR sciatic nerve block, posterior lumbar plexus block
arm_group.description: TKR surgery under ultrasound guided sciatic nerve block plus posterior lumbar plexus block

brief_summary.textblock:
Total Knee Replacement can be performed under the combination of posterior lumbar plexus
      block plus sciatic nerve block. The investigators can have the same outcome by performing
      instead of posterior lumbar plexus block more peripheral nerve blocks. More specifically
      under the combination of sciatic nerve block plus femoral nerve block plus obturator nerve
      block.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ultrasound Guided Obturator Nerve Block for Total Knee Replacement (TKR)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Age 18 - 80 yrs

          -  ASA I - III

          -  TKR surgery

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Coagulopathy disorders

          -  Infection at the puncture site for the interscalene block

          -  Neurologic deficit in the arm that is going to be operated

          -  Allergy to local anesthetics

          -  BMI > 35

          -  Psychiatric disorders

          -  Patient's refusal

          -  Problems with patient communication

intervention.arm_group_label: TKR sciatic nerve block, posterior lumbar plexus block
intervention.intervention_name: Sciatic nerve block, posterior lumbar plexus block

clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Posterior Lumbar Plexus Block Plus Sciatic Nerve Block With Sciatic Plus Femoral Plus Obturator Nerve Block for Total Knee Replacement (TKR)

primary_outcome.description: If the patient complains for pain > 4 in VAS and there is no relief with fentanyl administration the anesthesia plan converts to general anesthesia with laryngeal mask
primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility of TKR surgery under ultrasound guided sciatic nerve block plus femoral nerve block plus obturator nerve block measured with Pain Score on the Visual Analog Scale

reference.citation: Enneking FK, Chan V, Greger J, Hadzi? A, Lang SA, Horlocker TT. Lower-extremity peripheral nerve blockade: essentials of our current understanding. Reg Anesth Pain Med. 2005 Jan-Feb;30(1):4-35. Review. No abstract available.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Intraoperative opioid consumption for TKR surgery under ultrasound guided sciatic nerve block plus femoral nerve block plus obturator nerve block

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Supportive Care
